description: Mr. Robot 1x01 Screenplay

Background Placebos are widely used in clinical practice in spite of ethical restrictions. Whether such use is justified depends in part on the relative benefit of placebos compared to 'active' treatments. A direct test for differences between placebo and 'active' treatment effects has not been conducted.

Photo: Nick Veasey Merck was in trouble. In 2002, the pharmaceutical giant was falling behind its rivals in sales. Even worse, patents on five blockbuster drugs were about to expire, which would allow cheaper generics to flood the market. The company hadn't introduced a truly new product in three years, and its stock price was plummeting.

are.na API wrapper for JavaScript
extended: are.na API wrapper for JavaScript - Uses Axios, which is Promise-based and compatible with Node.js/io.js or modern browsers. Use it server side, or in your React, Vue or Angular apps.

Frank Kolkman creates death simulation machine using virtual reality
extended: To tackle "death anxiety" among terminally ill hospital patients, designer Frank Kolkman has created a device that simulates a near-death experience using virtual reality.

description: Life After Death Experiences – Is Life a Simulation
extended: > From my experiences during a deep-dive 10-day meditation process, I experienced a non-physical aspect of myself, a True Self, that exists outside of space-time, that incarnates repeatedly into space-time, living multiple lives in our physical reality.  This, along with my experience of the basketball universes that stored each moment of now (including the limitless probabilities of future and past nows), and my experience that each of us creates our own basketball universes from a common pattern of reality

description: Ludic Fallacy
extended: Chaos theory plays a huge role in our universe, and it is way beyond the scope of this book.  As for this fallacy, many things that appear to be random are actually chaotic systems, or unpredictable, deterministic systems.  Attempting to apply the rules of random probability in those cases will result in all kinds of errors.

description: Nassim Taleb's Fat Tony Example / And: Is it possible to flip 100 Heads in a row? | Untrammeled Mind
extended:
> Assume that a coin is fair, i.e., has an equal probability of coming up heads or tails when flipped. I flip it ninety-nine times and get heads each time. What are the odds of my getting tails on my next throw?

> Dr. John refers to the question as trivial and gives the mathematically correct answer of one half. Fat Tony calls Dr. John a sucker and says, “no more than 1 percent, of course … the coin gotta be loaded.”

description: Suárez Miranda, Viajes de varones prudentes, Libro IV, Cap. XLV, Lérida, 1658
Simulacra and Simulation - Wikipedia
extended:
+ The first stage is a faithful image/copy, where we believe, and it may even be correct...
+ The second stage is perversion of reality, this is where we come to believe the sign to be an unfaithful copy... but can hint at the existence of an obscure reality which the sign itself is incapable of encapsulating.
+ The third stage masks the absence of a profound reality, where the sign pretends to be a faithful copy, but it is a copy with no original. Signs and images claim to represent something real, but no representation is taking place and arbitrary images are merely suggested as things which they have no relationship to.
+ The fourth stage is pure simulacrum, in which the simulacrum has no relationship to any reality whatsoever.

How Much Caffeine is Really in Coffee | Food & Wine
extended: There's a classic caffeine study in which a researcher bought a 16-ounce Breakfast Blend from the same Starbucks on six consecutive days and found that the caffeine content fluctuated wildly, swinging from 259 to 564 milligrams. That’s analogous to a bottle of wine suddenly turning into whiskey

description: Should kids be able to order Uber Eats to school? An infuriated Georgia educator posted this pic on Facebook showing how much food was collected after ONE HOUR. He asks how can teachers teach when 1,000 students are randomly calling and meeting Uber on the street #MorningRushATL

extended: Open Flame is a router paired with a candle. To bring up this network the candle must be lit and when it is blown out, the network disappears.

Ranked.Vote: Results from Instant Runoff Elections
extended: Ranked-choice voting systems, such as Instant Runoff Voting, produce a richer set of data than more standard plurality systems. The reports linked below allow you to explore the results of each election in detail.
